title.value: Subcortical brain alterations in carriers of genomic copy number variants
title.justification: The title explicitly mentions the focus on subcortical brain alterations in individuals with genomic copy number variants.
title.quote: Subcortical brain alterations in carriers of genomic copy number variants

extractions.description: This study examines subcortical brain alterations associated with genomic copy number variants (CNVs) and their relationship to neurodevelopmental and psychiatric disorders (NPDs). It uses MRI data to assess volumetric and shape changes in subcortical structures among CNV carriers, evaluating correlations with disease risk and cognitive impact.

type.justification: The study uses empirical data from MRI scans to investigate subcortical brain alterations in individuals with CNVs, focusing on measurable changes and correlations.
type.quote: To this end, we assembled the largest T1-weighted brain MRI dataset across all recurrent CNVs...

name.justification: The research focuses on brain alterations, specifically subcortical structures, which is a field within neuroscience.
name.quote: Subcortical brain structures play a critical role in cognitive, affective, and social functions in humans.

name.justification: The study utilizes MRI data to assess brain structures, situating it within the neuroimaging subfield.
name.quote: We assembled the largest T1-weighted brain MRI dataset across all recurrent CNVs...

name.justification: The UK Biobank is mentioned as a source of CNV carrier data for this study.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not specify its source. It is a common dataset for studies in this field.
